titles: The Debtford frollick; or, A hue and cry after the shag-breeches. Young vvoman all, both great and small, that handleth pot or pail, for some I hear, and greatly fear. Do oft play with their tayl. Tune of, The fair one let me in.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in Pye-corner.,
notes: Verse: "One night when blustering winds blew ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
